description: In addition to outdoor amenities, Virginia Avenue Park is home to a vibrant community center offering a variety of free educational, recreational programs and activities for Santa Monica families of all ages and abilities.
The Virginia Avenue Park Advisory Board meets every first Monday of the month at 7:00 PM at Virginia Avenue Park. The Board advises staff on programs and events at the Park.
Virginia Avenue Park Advisory Board
The Virginia Avenue Park Advisory Board meets every first Monday of the month at 7:00 PM at Virginia Avenue Park. The Board advises staff on programs and events at the Park.
name: Virginia Avenue Park
Ocean View Park
description: Ocean View Park features tennis, basketball and paddle tennis courts, along with a popular expanse of lawn and a grassy hill with spiral walkway leading to the top. The southern edge of the park is bounded by Ashland Walk, a short walking path that connects the Main Street area with the beach.

General: 2 youth baseball fields with concession stand
Community Meeting Rooms: Craft Room can hold up to 40 people

Reed Park Multipurpose Room: Can accommodate up to 90 people
Can be split into 2 rooms (east & west rooms)
Either room can accommodate up to 46 people
Kitchen is not available for public use
Restrooms inside

General.text: Basketball courts (1 full and 3 half-courts) with lights |Reservation Info

General: 2 tennis courts (1 with lights) - Open during school hours

name: Los Amigos Park
address: 500 Hollister Avenue (adjacent to John Muir Elementary and SMASH)
description: The City began leasing the site from the Santa Monica Malibu School District for use as a park in 1954. The park’s name was chosen through a contest, with the winning suggestion coming from a 13-yr old who received $25. Today, the School District and City share use of the park. SMASH students use it during school hours, and facilities open to the public during non-school hours.

Joslyn Park Craft Room: Craft Room holds up to 40 people

General.text: community center with auditorium, kitchen and craft room |Reservation Info
Herb Katz Dog Park, with separate small dog and large dog sections |Info

name: Hotchkiss Park
description: Hotchkiss Park was originally the site of the Moody Mansion, believed to be haunted after owner Mary Hotchkiss’ first husband was murdered there in 1884. Today the park’s peek-a-boo ocean views offer a place for quiet contemplation, while its sloping lawn plays host to many picnics on weekends.

Marine Park Auditorium.text: Auditorium holds up to 120 people |Reservation Info

General.text: birthday pavilion, picnic tables and BBQs |Reservation Info
10 community garden plots (2 accessible) and garden class area |Info

Euclid Meeting Rooms: Euclid East Room holds up to 23 people
Euclid West Room holds up to 18 people
Small kitchen
1 restroom
3 off-alley parking spaces and street parking available

description: Douglas Park Clubhouse is available to rent.
name: Douglas Park

General: Grass lawn with benches and ocean view (upper level)

name: Colorado Center Park
description: Colorado Center Park is a publicly-accessible park owned and maintained by the Colorado Center as part of a Development Agreement.

General: 14 large tables with 4 chess boards per table
10 small tables with 1 chess board per table
Large chess board with large chess pieces
How to use the large chess pieces at Che: Visit the Police Substation on the Pier to get the key for the chess pieces locker.
You will be required to sign a form and leave your license until the key is returned.
When you are done with the chess pieces, put them back in the locker and return the key to the Police Substation.
The key may not be kept overnight.

description: Chess Park features a collection of chess tables including a human-scale board with large pieces. The park is open sunrise to sunset, with the table available on a first-come, first-serve basis.
The large-scale chess pieces are available for public use!

Please note: You are completely responsible for the care and safekeeping of the chess pieces while the key is in your possession. If they are destroyed or damaged, you will be required to pay for the replacement or repair cost.
Office hours vary by season. Call 310-458-8450
address: Ocean Front Walk at Seaside Terrace
name: Chess Park
Beach Park 1
address: 2600 Barnard Way at Ocean Park Blvd.
description: This beachfront park is located between Hart Avenue and Hill Street on the beach side of Barnard Way. In the center of the park is a large paved plaza aligned with the end of Ocean Park Boulevard. The plaza has a double alley of dramatic palm trees, rows of bollards and is bookended by Michele Oka Doner’s “Wave and Shell Obelisks” and Joyce Kohl’s “Ocean Park Seque” sculptures. The plaza area, paths, turf and picnic areas were designed in 1985 by Campbell and Campbell. The park features several open grassy areas, rows of picnic tables, a Children’s playground and a public restroom. In 2010, City Council dedicated Beach Park #1 in honor of environmentalist Dorothy Green.

name: South Beach Park
description: South Beach Park is located between Barnard Way and the beach bike path on the Venice border. Adjacent parking is available in the southern-most beach parking lot.

General.text: Off-leash dog area with separate small & large dog areas |Dog Park Information
Synthetic turf sports field with lights |Permit Info
17 picnic tables with 6 BBQ grills |Reservation Info

name: Park Drive Park
description: A linear green space located along Park Drive between Santa Monica Boulevard and Broadway, this park is largely occupied by fenced community gardens. In the center of the park there is a small well-shaded grassy area.

General: Old concession building (used for league storage)

name: Stewart Street Park
description: Stewart Street Park is a quiet neighborhood park.

name: Schader Park
description: The smallest of Santa Monica’s parks, this green space faces Cloverfield Boulevard and is near Santa Monica Boulevard. With one bench, a trash receptacle and a number of large shade trees, Schader Park is within walking distance of many office buildings and is a perfect spot for eating lunch or taking a break from work.

name: Ozone Park
description: This linear park is located along the southern edge of the city where Santa Monica meets Venice. Playgrounds on the eastern and western ends of the park bookend a grassy lawn edged with large shade trees.

General: 26.4 acres - a City of Santa Monica Landmark!
Amazing views of Santa Monica Bay

name: Barnard Way Linear Park
description: Located on the beach side of Barnard Way between Bicknell Avenue and Ocean Park Boulevard, this linear park is at a higher elevation than the beach which allows for panoramic views of the shoreline and the Santa Monica Pier. Two stairways located at Pacific and Strand Streets provide access to beach lots.

General: Old concession building (used for league storage)

description: Stewart Street Park is a quiet neighborhood park.

description: Colorado Center Park is a publicly-accessible park owned and maintained by the Colorado Center as part of a Development Agreement.

General: 14 large tables with 4 chess boards per table
10 small tables with 1 chess board per table
Large chess board with large chess pieces
How to use the large chess pieces at Che: Visit the Police Substation on the Pier to get the key for the chess pieces locker.
You will be required to sign a form and leave your license until the key is returned.
When you are done with the chess pieces, put them back in the locker and return the key to the Police Substation.
The key may not be kept overnight.

description: Chess Park features a collection of chess tables including a human-scale board with large pieces. The park is open sunrise to sunset, with the table available on a first-come, first-serve basis.
The large-scale chess pieces are available for public use!

Please note: You are completely responsible for the care and safekeeping of the chess pieces while the key is in your possession. If they are destroyed or damaged, you will be required to pay for the replacement or repair cost.
Office hours vary by season. Call 310-458-8450
description.address: Ocean Front Walk at Seaside Terrace
description.name: Chess Park

General: Grass lawn with benches and ocean view (upper level)

description: In addition to outdoor amenities, Virginia Avenue Park is home to a vibrant community center offering a variety of free educational, recreational programs and activities for Santa Monica families of all ages and abilities.
The Virginia Avenue Park Advisory Board meets every first Monday of the month at 7:00 PM at Virginia Avenue Park. The Board advises staff on programs and events at the Park.
Virginia Avenue Park Advisory Board
The Virginia Avenue Park Advisory Board meets every first Monday of the month at 7:00 PM at Virginia Avenue Park. The Board advises staff on programs and events at the Park.
description.name: Virginia Avenue Park
Ozone Park
description: This linear park is located along the southern edge of the city where Santa Monica meets Venice. Playgrounds on the eastern and western ends of the park bookend a grassy lawn edged with large shade trees.

description.name: Ocean View Park
description: Ocean View Park features tennis, basketball and paddle tennis courts, along with a popular expanse of lawn and a grassy hill with spiral walkway leading to the top. The southern edge of the park is bounded by Ashland Walk, a short walking path that connects the Main Street area with the beach.

Marine Park Auditorium.text: Auditorium holds up to 120 people Reservation Info

General.text: birthday pavilion, picnic tables and BBQs Reservation Info

description.name: Schader Park
description: The smallest of Santa Monica’s parks, this green space faces Cloverfield Boulevard and is near Santa Monica Boulevard. With one bench, a trash receptacle and a number of large shade trees, Schader Park is within walking distance of many office buildings and is a perfect spot for eating lunch or taking a break from work.

Reed Park Multipurpose Room: Can accommodate up to 90 people
Can be split into 2 rooms (east & west rooms)
Either room can accommodate up to 46 people
Kitchen is not available for public use
Restrooms inside

description.name: Los Amigos Park
description.address: 500 Hollister Avenue (adjacent to John Muir Elementary and SMASH)
description: The City began leasing the site from the Santa Monica Malibu School District for use as a park in 1954. The park’s name was chosen through a contest, with the winning suggestion coming from a 13-yr old who received $25. Today, the School District and City share use of the park. SMASH students use it during school hours, and facilities open to the public during non-school hours.

General: 2 youth baseball fields with concession stand

General.text: 1 off-leash dog run Dog Park Information

Community Meeting Rooms: Craft Room can hold up to 40 people

description.name: Colorado Center Park
description: Colorado Center Park is a publicly-accessible park owned and maintained by the Colorado Center as part of a Development Agreement.

description.name: Beach Park 1
description.address: 2600 Barnard Way at Ocean Park Blvd.
description: This beachfront park is located between Hart Avenue and Hill Street on the beach side of Barnard Way. In the center of the park is a large paved plaza aligned with the end of Ocean Park Boulevard. The plaza has a double alley of dramatic palm trees, rows of bollards and is bookended by Michele Oka Doner’s “Wave and Shell Obelisks” and Joyce Kohl’s “Ocean Park Seque” sculptures. The plaza area, paths, turf and picnic areas were designed in 1985 by Campbell and Campbell. The park features several open grassy areas, rows of picnic tables, a Children’s playground and a public restroom. In 2010, City Council dedicated Beach Park #1 in honor of environmentalist Dorothy Green.

General.text: Off-leash dog area with separate small & large dog areas Dog Park Information
Synthetic turf sports field with lights Permit Info
17 picnic tables with 6 BBQ grills Reservation Info

description.name: Barnard Way Linear Park
description: Located on the beach side of Barnard Way between Bicknell Avenue and Ocean Park Boulevard, this linear park is at a higher elevation than the beach which allows for panoramic views of the shoreline and the Santa Monica Pier. Two stairways located at Pacific and Strand Streets provide access to beach lots.

General: Grass lawn with benches and ocean view (upper level)

description.name: Hotchkiss Park
description: Hotchkiss Park was originally the site of the Moody Mansion, believed to be haunted after owner Mary Hotchkiss’ first husband was murdered there in 1884. Today the park’s peek-a-boo ocean views offer a place for quiet contemplation, while its sloping lawn plays host to many picnics on weekends.

General: Amazing views of Santa Monica Bay

You will be required to sign a form and leave your license until the key is returned.
When you are done with the chess pieces, put them back in the locker and return the key to the Police Substation.
The key may not be kept overnight.

The large-scale chess pieces are available for public use!

Please note: You are completely responsible for the care and safekeeping of the chess pieces while the key is in your possession. If they are destroyed or damaged, you will be required to pay for the replacement or repair cost.
Office hours vary by season. Call 310-458-8450
